name: Kikunoi Honten
short_description: 3-Michelin star kaiseki restaurant with over 100 years of history, known for seasonal multi-course traditional Kyoto cuisine

name: Hyotei
short_description: 400-year-old kaiseki restaurant originating as a tea house, awarded 3 Michelin stars for 15 consecutive years

name: Nishiki Market
short_description: Kyoto's Kitchen - 400-year-old covered market with 130+ stalls selling fresh seafood, pickles, tofu, street food, and local specialties

name: Ramen Touhichi
short_description: Michelin Bib Gourmand ramen shop famous for chicken shoyu ramen using high-quality local Tanda and Nagoya Kochin chicken

name: Gion Duck Noodles
short_description: Unique duck ramen shop with emoji menu, featuring French-trained chef using German rye wheat noodles and rich duck broth

name: Kobushi Ramen
short_description: Bib Gourmand ramen near Kyoto Station featuring rare duck and nodoguro (blackthroat sea perch) combination broth

name: Gion Kappa
short_description: Popular foreigner-friendly izakaya in the geisha district serving sushi, grilled meats, sake and traditional small plates

name: Pontocho Masuda
short_description: Traditional izakaya in Pontocho serving authentic Obanzai (Kyoto home-style cuisine) including vinegared mackerel and duck

name: Tempura Yoshikawa
short_description: Kyoto's finest tempura in a beautiful traditional wooden building with garden, featuring an 11-seat counter and refined kaiseki-style service

name: Tempura Kyoboshi
short_description: 2-Michelin star tempura restaurant with recipes passed down for 3 generations, serving light and crispy seasonal tempura

name: Shinpuku Saikan
short_description: Historic ramen shop near Kyoto Station specializing in rich soy sauce (shoyu) ramen - a local institution since 1938

name: Gion Yuki
short_description: Cozy traditional izakaya in the heart of Gion with English menu, offering wide range of small plates and excellent sake selection

name: Towzen
short_description: 100% plant-based ramen restaurant with tatami seating, famous for creamy soy milk ramen - great for vegetarians and vegans

name: Kyoto Ramen Koji
short_description: Ramen street on 10th floor of Kyoto Station featuring 9 regional ramen styles from across Japan including Hakata and Sapporo

name: Pontocho Alley
short_description: Atmospheric narrow alley along Kamogawa River with traditional izakayas, restaurants and bars - summer kawadoko riverside dining available
